meanings.definition: An area that is surrounded by a fence or wall.
meanings.sent1: The farmer built a sturdy inclosure to keep the sheep safe.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a beautiful inclosure made of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to escape the inclosure by climbing over the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter created an invisible inclosure around them, shutting out the world.
meanings.sent5: The inclosure of trees created a peaceful sanctuary in the middle of the bustling city.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing something within a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The inclosure of the valuable jewels was necessary to protect them from theft.
meanings.sent2: His inclosure of the secret recipe ensured that no one else could replicate it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's inclosure of the rabbit in the hat surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: The inclosure of emotions within her heart made it hard for others to understand her.
meanings.sent5: The inclosure of the garden with a high fence kept the pesky rabbits out.

meanings.definition: A document or letter that is included with another document.
meanings.sent1: Please find the inclosure containing the additional information attached to this email.
meanings.sent2: The inclosure with the contract details must be signed and returned by Friday.
meanings.sent3: The inclosure of the map helped the travelers navigate through the unknown terrain.
meanings.sent4: Her inclosure of the apology letter softened the blow of her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The inclosure of the receipt confirmed the purchase of the new furniture.
